macro.php

00001 <table class="manual" id="basic">
00002   <caption>macros</caption>
00003   <tr>
00004     <th>Statement</th>
00005     <th>Description</th>
00006   </tr>
00007   <tr>
00008     <td colspan="2">
00009       <p>Much like cpp(1) or m4(1), macros can be defined that will later be expanded 
00010          in context.  Macro names must start with a letter, and may contain
00011          letters, digits and underscores.  Macro names may not be reserved words
00012          (for example pass, in, out).  Macros are not expanded inside quotes.</p>
00013 
00014       <p>For example,</p>
00015 
00016 <pre>
00017 ext_if = "kue0"
00018 all_ifs = "{" $ext_if lo0 "}"
00019 pass out on $ext_if from any to any keep state
00020 pass in  on $ext_if proto tcp from any to any port 25 keep state
00021 </pre>
00022     </td>
00023   </tr>
00024 </table>
